Sentencas: In order to address the shortcomings of the solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) associated with the thin electrode, the anode-cathode-supported SOFC (ACSC) is proposed in this study.
Titulo: Effects of changes in solid oxide fuel cell electrode thickness on ohmic and concentration polarizations

Sentencas: In the ACSC, the electrolyte is thin, while both the anode and cathode have enough thickness to act as self-supporting layers.
Titulo: Effects of changes in solid oxide fuel cell electrode thickness on ohmic and concentration polarizations

Sentencas: The mathematical models of both the anode-supported SOFC (ASC) and ACSC are established, which capture the intricate interdependency among the charge and gas transport, and the electrochemical reactions.
Titulo: Effects of changes in solid oxide fuel cell electrode thickness on ohmic and concentration polarizations

Sentencas: The validity of the mathematical model is preliminarily verified by the good agreement between the numerical and experimental I-V curves of the ASC button cell.
Titulo: Effects of changes in solid oxide fuel cell electrode thickness on ohmic and concentration polarizations

Sentencas: For the same base case parameters and operating conditions, the average current density of ASC is 6388 A m(-2), only 83% of the ACSC, 7713 A m(-2).
Titulo: Effects of changes in solid oxide fuel cell electrode thickness on ohmic and concentration polarizations

Sentencas: The advantages of ACSC mainly stem from two aspects: i) the increased oxygen concentration under the solid rib covered zone, which extends the reaction active zone; ii) the increased cross section of the electric current transport path, which greatly decreases the cathode ohmic polarization.
Titulo: Effects of changes in solid oxide fuel cell electrode thickness on ohmic and concentration polarizations

Sentencas: The performance comparison between the ACSC and ASC are examined by systematically varying the cathode electric conductivity, porosity, tortuosity factor and the output voltage.
Titulo: Effects of changes in solid oxide fuel cell electrode thickness on ohmic and concentration polarizations

Sentencas: The results indicated that the advantage of ACSC over ASC is always obvious although the performance of ACSC varies with different parameters.
Titulo: Effects of changes in solid oxide fuel cell electrode thickness on ohmic and concentration polarizations
